intro: Linaria bauhini, commonly known as the golden larkspur, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its striking, elongated, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has slender, branching stems covered in fine hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped and alternate along the stem, often with a slightly hairy texture. Linaria bauhini thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
